newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-GWA says local outlook is weak.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-GWA says local outlook is weak.

text.p: Bathroom products and outdoor furniture group GWA International ltd said on Wednesday that it expected domestic demand for building products and consumer spending to remain depressed in the final six months of 1996/97.
The company said it expected an improvement in these sectors late in calendar 1997.
Export sales helped the company offset difficult trading conditions in the current domestic market, it said in a statement with its 1996/97 (July-June) first half profit result.
Net profit fell 9.3 percent to A$16.09 million and sales fell to A$168.66 million from A$179.79 million.

"The fall in dwelling construction, poor seasonal conditions, slow consumer spending and limited state and gederal government spending impacted upon demand for GWA International's products in the first half of the year," GWA chairman Barry Thornton said.

"(Furniture retailer) Sebel's performance was lower than expected due partly to the lack of demand from government spending, particularly in New South Wales, and delays in the release of tenders for major Olympic contracts," he said.
GWA shares were two cents lower at A$2.29 at 12.20 p.m. (0120 GMT). -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
